[[File:Omega Speedmaster Rueckseite-2.jpg|thumb|upright|The [[Omega Speedmaster Professional|Omega ''Speedmaster'']], a Swiss-made watch worn on the moon during the [[Apollo program|Apollo]] missions. In terms of value, Switzerland is responsible for half of the world production of watches.<ref name = FCO/><ref>[http://www.swissworld.org/en/economy/key_sectors/watches/ Watches] swissworld.org. [[File:Omega Speedmaster Rueckseite-2.jpg|thumb|upright|The [[Omega Speedmaster Professional|Omega ''Speedmaster'']], a Swiss-made watch worn on the moon during the [[Apollo program|Apollo]] missions. In terms of value, Switzerland is responsible for half of the world production of watches.<ref name = FCO/><ref>[http://www.swissworld.org/en/economy/key_sectors/watches/ Watches] swissworld.org. Retrieved on 2009-07-20</ref>]]
â
Switzerland has a stable, modern and one of the most [[capitalism|capitalist]] economies in the world. It has the 2nd highest European rating after [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] in the [[Index of Economic Freedom]] 2008, while also providing large coverage through public services. The nominal per capita [[Gross Domestic Product|GDP]] is higher than those of the larger western European economies and Japan, ranking 6th behind Luxembourg, Norway, Qatar, Iceland and Ireland. The [[Swiss franc]] remains one of the world's strongest currencies with the lowest inflation rate.<ref>[http://www.cp-pc.ca/english/switzerland/ The world of work] cp-pc.ca. Retrieved on 2009-12-14</ref>
+
Switzerland has a stable, modern and one of the most [[capitalism|capitalist]] economies in the world{{Citation needed| March 2010 |date=March 2010}}. It has the 2nd highest European rating after [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] in the [[Index of Economic Freedom]] 2008, while also providing large coverage through public services. The nominal per capita [[Gross Domestic Product|GDP]] is higher than those of the larger western European economies and Japan, ranking 6th behind Luxembourg, Norway, Qatar, Iceland and Ireland. The [[Swiss franc]] remains one of the world's strongest currencies with the lowest inflation rate.<ref>[http://www.cp-pc.ca/english/switzerland/ The world of work] cp-pc.ca. Retrieved on 2009-12-14</ref>
